title: Margaret Trowe
text:
Margaret Trowe (born 1948) is an American <a href="communist">communist</a> and <a href="women%27s%20rights">women's rights</a> activist. She was the 2000 United States vice presidential candidate for the <a href="Socialist%20Workers%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Socialist Workers Party</a>; she also appeared as their VP candidate in 2004 in those states where official candidate <a href="Arrin%20Hawkins">Arrin Hawkins</a> was excluded from the ballot for being constitutionally ineligible to serve as vice president.
Trowe had run for <a href="United%20States%20Senator">United States Senator</a> for Iowa in 1998 and received 2,400 votes. She also received one <a href="Write-in%20candidate">write-in vote</a> for <a href="President%20of%20the%20United%20States">President of the United States</a> in the <a href="2004%20United%20States%20presidential%20election">2004 election</a>. In 2006, she was a candidate for <a href="Florida%27s%2018th%20congressional%20district">Florida's 18th congressional district</a>.
